result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shane A. McNamar

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shane A. McNamar appeared in person with his Attorney Wright Laufenberg.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights have been complied with.  The State moves to dismiss and read in this case for sentencing.  The court ordered that this case be dismissed and read in for sentencing.  - rt
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 17, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Shane A. McNamar in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State filed its standard motions.  Defense has not filed any motions.  No objection by defense regarding state's motions.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.  - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.
Motion hearing on May 25, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Court calls case Nos. 15CF82, 15CF83, 15CF84, 15CF85, 15CF87 and 15CF90.  Defendant Shane A. McNamar in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of preliminary hearing filed - based on waiver court bound DE over for trial.  Information filed by the state.  DE waived further reading of same and entered pleas of not guilty to all the charges.   Atty Laufenberg requests to file motions for discovery and to file motions. Court grants requests.   State filed motion to revoke bond on all cases.  Argument.  15CF82 - Court orders $5,000.00 cash be forfeited. 15CF83 - Court orders $500.00 cash be forfeited.  Court will not forfeit signature bonds at this time.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 02:00 pm. ba

to Revoke Cash and Signature Bonds and Proposed Order to Revoke Cash and Signature Bonds
Objection to State's Proposed Motion and Order to Revoke Bond

Defendant Shane A. McNamar in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg by phone.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Laufenberg waived the reading of the complaint.  Defendant is waiving the time limits for a preliminary hearing.  Court finds defendant freely waives the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Court orders a $1,000.00 signature bond with booking.   Pretrial conference scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 2:45 pm.  - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.
*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.
